what: Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
title: Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
text: Plots two lines fitted unique, sorted log degrees graph.

title: Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
text: object output function 'extract_sparse' ... arguments currently ignored

title: Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
text: ggplot object.

title: Plots the output of extract_sparse function. — autoplot.extract_sparse
code: library(igraph) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘igraph’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     decompose, spectrum #> The following object is masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     union gr <- sample_pa(10000, power = 1.2, directed = FALSE) sparse <- extract_sparse(gr) autoplot(sparse)

text: nrow dimension matrix scalar scalar exp(-(+j)/scalar)

title: Computes empirical graphon from graph — empirical_graphon
text: Computes empirical graphon given graph

title: Computes empirical graphon from graph — empirical_graphon
Computes empirical graphon from graph — empirical_graphon
text: gr graph n Dimension graphon matrix

title: Computes empirical graphon from graph — empirical_graphon
text: empirical graphon

title: Computes empirical graphon from graph — empirical_graphon
code: library(igraph) gr <- sample_gnp(1000, p=0.2) emp <-  empirical_graphon(gr, n = 100)

what: Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse
title: Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse
text: function extracts sparse component (U,W) mixture graph fitting two lines unique sorted log degree values. first line gives number hubs sparse part remaining line fits degrees dense part.

title: Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse
Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse
text: gr input graph

title: Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse
text: list following components: num_hubs number hubs sparse component. phat probability vector sparse component. also known mass partition. segment_sizes sizes two line segments. line_equations two equations lines. cutoff best cut two lines. models models fitted lines. mse mean squared error data degree data.

title: Extracts the sparse part from a (U,W) graphon mixture — extract_sparse

text: wts proportion hub degrees n number nodes new graph

text: disjoint union star graphs

title: Generates a sparse graph of star graphs — generate_star_union

what: graphonmix: Generates Mixture Graphs from Dense and Sparse Graphons — graphonmix-package
title: graphonmix: Generates Mixture Graphs from Dense and Sparse Graphons — graphonmix-package
text: Generates (U,W) mixture graphs U line graph graphon W dense graphon. Graphons graph limits graphon U can written sequence positive numbers adding 1. Graphs sampled U W joined randomly obtain mixture graph. Given mixture graph, U can inferred.

what: Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
title: Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
text: Predicts degree hubs unseen graph given graph generated process.

title: Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
text: gr input graph n number nodes new graph k number hubs. Default NULL

title: Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
text: vector hub degrees

title: Predicts the degree of hubs of an new graph — predict_hubs
code: library(igraph) gr <- sample_pa(10000, power = 1.2, directed = FALSE) predict_hubs(gr, n = 11000) #> [1] 541 317 110

what: Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
title: Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
text: Generates graph given dense graphon W.

title: Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
text: W graphon given matrix n number nodes sampled graph

title: Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
text: graph sampled graphon W n nodes

title: Generates a graph given a graphon — sample_graphon
code: library(igraph) W <- matrix(0.2, nrow = 100, ncol = 100) gr <- sample_graphon(W, n= 100)

title: Generate a (U,W) mixture graph — sample_mixed_graph
text: Generate (U,W) mixture graph dense graphon W mass partition corresponding line graph graphon U.

title: Generate a (U,W) mixture graph — sample_mixed_graph
code: sample_mixed_graph(W, wts, nd, ns, p, option)

title: Generate a (U,W) mixture graph — sample_mixed_graph
text: W dense graphon. symmetric matrix values [0,1] wts degree proportions hub degrees. Need add 1. mass partition corresponding line graph graphon U. nd number nodes dense part graph ns number nodes sparse part graph p nodes added proportion edges dense part option Graph joining option. option == 1 disjoit union considered. option == 2 two graphs joined randomly number edges specified p.

title: Generate a (U,W) mixture graph — sample_mixed_graph
text: graph sampled (U,W) mixture.

title: Generate a (U,W) mixture graph — sample_mixed_graph

what: Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
title: Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
text: Scales graphon nxn matrix suitable large adjacency matrices

title: Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
text: W graphon given symmetric square matrix n dimension output matrix

title: Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
text: Scaled nxn graphon

title: Scales a graphon to an nxn matrix — scale_graphon
code: library(igraph) gr <- sample_gnp(1000, p=0.2) adj <- as_adjacency_matrix(gr) W <- scale_graphon(adj, 100)
